prosody.text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. This means doctors and staff can spend more time with patients and less time dealing with insurance forms. If you have any specific questions or want to know how it might help your organization, just let me know!

prosody.text: Me through the workflow of how your platform works with the electronic health records and payers?
prosody.speaker: Customer
prosody.transcript_text: Me through the workflow of how your platform works with the electronic health records and payers?

prosody.text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

prosody.text: Um, how do I get and get started with own provider?
prosody.speaker: Customer
prosody.transcript_text: Um, how do I get and get started with own provider?

prosody.text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,
prosody.speaker: Agent

That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

prosody.text:
Thanks for clarifying, Kway! For a setup like yours—with one MD provider and six RNs—pricing is really straightforward.

EasyPA’s Pro Plan is $250 per month for each provider. In your case, since you have one MD, your clinic would pay $250 per month. This covers unlimited prior authorizations for your whole team, including your RNs, as long as they’re working under that provider.

There are no hidden fees, no setup costs, and you can cancel anytime. The subscription is month-to-month, so you’re not locked into a long-term contract. Everything is

prosody.text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

Of course, Kway! Here’s a quick overview of EasyPA’s funding and business milestones.

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

If you’d like, I can connect you with the founders or send you more detailed

The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

Absolutely, Kway! There are a few big names in the prior authorization and healthcare automation space—some of the main competitors include Waystar, Availity, Innovaccer, Cohere Health, and Anterior. Some EHRs also try to build their own native solutions.

What really sets EasyPA apart is a few key things. First, we have a proprietary Denial Genome dataset, which makes our AI models more accurate at predicting and preventing denials. Our platform covers the full cycle—from detecting when a prior authorization is needed, to submitting, tracking, and even appealing denials—all in one workflow. Most competitors only handle part of that process.

EasyPA is also built with a “FHIR-first” approach, so it’s already compliant with the latest CMS interoperability rules and future-proof for upcoming mandates. Plus, our workflows are designed by physicians, which

prosody.text:
I’m glad to hear you’re interested, Kway! There are a few strong reasons why EasyPA stands out as an investment opportunity.

First, the prior authorization market is huge and growing, especially with the new federal mandates pushing every provider and payer to adopt electronic solutions. EasyPA is already ahead of the curve, fully compliant and ready for the 2026 CMS rules, which puts us in a great position as the industry shifts.

Second, our team is made up of experienced healthcare and technology leaders who really understand the pain points from both sides—clinical and technical. That’s helped us build a product that’s not just smart, but actually easy for clinics to use and adopt.

Third, EasyPA’s technology is unique. Our AI-driven platform automates the entire prior auth process, reduces denials, and saves clinics a ton of time and money. We’re also one of the only platforms that offers a full-cycle solution, from detection to appeals, and we’re already seeing strong early traction with clinics and partners.

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

Of course, Kway! Here’s a quick overview of EasyPA’s funding and business milestones.

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

If you’d like, I can connect you with the founders or send you more detailed

Absolutely, Kway! There are a few big names in the prior authorization and healthcare automation space—some of the main competitors include Waystar, Availity, Innovaccer, Cohere Health, and Anterior. Some EHRs also try to build their own native solutions.

What really sets EasyPA apart is a few key things. First, we have a proprietary Denial Genome dataset, which makes our AI models more accurate at predicting and preventing denials. Our platform covers the full cycle—from detecting when a prior authorization is needed, to submitting, tracking, and even appealing denials—all in one workflow. Most competitors only handle part of that process.

EasyPA is also built with a “FHIR-first” approach, so it’s already compliant with the latest CMS interoperability rules and future-proof for upcoming mandates. Plus, our workflows are designed by physicians, which

burst.transcript_text:
Great question, Kway! FHIR stands for “Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources.” It’s a modern standard for exchanging healthcare information electronically, making it much easier for different systems—like EHRs, payers, and apps—to talk to each other securely and efficiently.

When we say EasyPA is “FHIR-first,” it

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text: Exactly, Kway! FHIR works through secure APIs, which let EasyPA connect directly to other platforms—like EHRs, imaging systems, and payers—within their own environments. This means data moves safely and quickly, without manual entry or risky file transfers. It’s all about making integration smooth, secure, and compliant with healthcare regulations.

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text:
I’m glad to hear you’re interested, Kway! There are a few strong reasons why EasyPA stands out as an investment opportunity.

First, the prior authorization market is huge and growing, especially with the new federal mandates pushing every provider and payer to adopt electronic solutions. EasyPA is already ahead of the curve, fully compliant and ready for the 2026 CMS rules, which puts us in a great position as the industry shifts.

Second, our team is made up of experienced healthcare and technology leaders who really understand the pain points from both sides—clinical and technical. That’s helped us build a product that’s not just smart, but actually easy for clinics to use and adopt.

Third, EasyPA’s technology is unique. Our AI-driven platform automates the entire prior auth process, reduces denials, and saves clinics a ton of time and money. We’re also one of the only platforms that offers a full-cycle solution, from detection to appeals, and we’re already seeing strong early traction with clinics and partners.

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. This means doctors and staff can spend more time with patients and less time dealing with insurance forms. If you have any specific questions or want to know how it might help your organization, just let me know!

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Me through the workflow of how your platform works with the electronic health records and payers?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Yeah. I wanna know about the integration process.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: And onboarding.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Um, how do I get and get started with own provider?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

retell_transcript_segments.text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

EasyPA’s Pro Plan is $250 per month for each provider. In your case, since you have one MD, your clinic would pay $250 per month. This covers unlimited prior authorizations for your whole team, including your RNs, as long as they’re working under that provider.

There are no hidden fees, no setup costs, and you can cancel anytime. The subscription is month-to-month, so you’re not locked into a long-term contract. Everything is

retell_transcript_segments.text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

retell_transcript_segments.text:
Of course, Kway! Here’s a quick overview of EasyPA’s funding and business milestones.

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

What really sets EasyPA apart is a few key things. First, we have a proprietary Denial Genome dataset, which makes our AI models more accurate at predicting and preventing denials. When we say EasyPA is “FHIR-first,” it

This means data moves safely and quickly, without manual entry or risky file transfers. It’s all about making integration smooth, secure, and compliant with healthcare regulations.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

prosody.transcript_text: Yeah. I wanna know about the integration process.

prosody.text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

prosody.text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?
prosody.speaker: Customer
prosody.transcript_text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

prosody.text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

prosody.transcript_text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

Thanks for clarifying, Kway! For a setup like yours—with one MD provider and six RNs—pricing is really straightforward.

EasyPA’s Pro Plan is $250 per month for each provider. In your case, since you have one MD, your clinic would pay $250 per month. This covers unlimited prior authorizations for your whole team, including your RNs, as long as they’re working under that provider.

There are no hidden fees, no setup costs, and you can cancel anytime. The subscription is month-to-month, so you’re not locked into a long-term contract. Everything is

prosody.text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

prosody.text:
Of course, Kway! Here’s a quick overview of EasyPA’s funding and business milestones.

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

If you’d like, I can connect you with the founders or send you more detailed

prosody.text:
I’m glad to hear you’re interested, Kway! There are a few strong reasons why EasyPA stands out as an investment opportunity.

First, the prior authorization market is huge and growing, especially with the new federal mandates pushing every provider and payer to adopt electronic solutions. EasyPA is already ahead of the curve, fully compliant and ready for the 2026 CMS rules, which puts us in a great position as the industry shifts.

Second, our team is made up of experienced healthcare and technology leaders who really understand the pain points from both sides—clinical and technical. That’s helped us build a product that’s not just smart, but actually easy for clinics to use and adopt.

Third, EasyPA’s technology is unique. Our AI-driven platform automates the entire prior auth process, reduces denials, and saves clinics a ton of time and money. We’re also one of the only platforms that offers a full-cycle solution, from detection to appeals, and we’re already seeing strong early traction with clinics and partners.

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

retell_transcript_segments.text: Thank you for calling EasyPA! This is Pam, how may I help you?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: I wanted to find out a little bit about EZPA and what you guys do.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Uh, my name is Kway.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. This means doctors and staff can spend more time with patients and less time dealing with insurance forms. If you have any specific questions or want to know how it might help your organization, just let me know!

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Me through the workflow of how your platform works with the electronic health records and payers?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Yeah. I wanna know about the integration process.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: And onboarding.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Um, how do I get and get started with own provider?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

retell_transcript_segments.text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

EasyPA’s Pro Plan is $250 per month for each provider. In your case, since you have one MD, your clinic would pay $250 per month. This covers unlimited prior authorizations for your whole team, including your RNs, as long as they’re working under that provider.

retell_transcript_segments.text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

retell_transcript_segments.text:
Of course, Kway! Here’s a quick overview of EasyPA’s funding and business milestones.

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.

What really sets EasyPA apart is a few key things. First, we have a proprietary Denial Genome dataset, which makes our AI models more accurate at predicting and preventing denials. When we say EasyPA is “FHIR-first,” it

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

prosody.text:
I’m glad to hear you’re interested, Kway! There are a few strong reasons why EasyPA stands out as an investment opportunity.

First, the prior authorization market is huge and growing, especially with the new federal mandates pushing every provider and payer to adopt electronic solutions. EasyPA is already ahead of the curve, fully compliant and ready for the 2026 CMS rules, which puts us in a great position as the industry shifts.

Second, our team is made up of experienced healthcare and technology leaders who really understand the pain points from both sides—clinical and technical. That’s helped us build a product that’s not just smart, but actually easy for clinics to use and adopt.

Third, EasyPA’s technology is unique. Our AI-driven platform automates the entire prior auth process, reduces denials, and saves clinics a ton of time and money. We’re also one of the only platforms that offers a full-cycle solution, from detection to appeals, and we’re already seeing strong early traction with clinics and partners.

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. This means doctors and staff can spend more time with patients and less time dealing with insurance forms. If you have any specific questions or want to know how it might help your organization, just let me know!

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

burst.speaker: Customer
burst.transcript_text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text:
Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

Our platform covers the full cycle—from detecting when a prior authorization is needed, to submitting, tracking, and even appealing denials—all in one workflow. Most competitors only handle part of that process.

When we say EasyPA is “FHIR-first,” it

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text: Exactly, Kway! FHIR works through secure APIs, which let EasyPA connect directly to other platforms—like EHRs, imaging systems, and payers—within their own environments. This means data moves safely and quickly, without manual entry or risky file transfers. It’s all about making integration smooth, secure, and compliant with healthcare regulations.

burst.speaker: Agent
burst.transcript_text:
I’m glad to hear you’re interested, Kway! There are a few strong reasons why EasyPA stands out as an investment opportunity.

First, the prior authorization market is huge and growing, especially with the new federal mandates pushing every provider and payer to adopt electronic solutions. EasyPA is already ahead of the curve, fully compliant and ready for the 2026 CMS rules, which puts us in a great position as the industry shifts.

Second, our team is made up of experienced healthcare and technology leaders who really understand the pain points from both sides—clinical and technical. That’s helped us build a product that’s not just smart, but actually easy for clinics to use and adopt.

Third, EasyPA’s technology is unique. Our AI-driven platform automates the entire prior auth process, reduces denials, and saves clinics a ton of time and money. We’re also one of the only platforms that offers a full-cycle solution, from detection to appeals, and we’re already seeing strong early traction with clinics and partners.

Finally, the business model is recurring revenue, which means predictable growth as we scale. With the upcoming mandates, the demand is only going to increase.

If you’d like, I can help set up a meeting with the founders so you can ask more detailed questions and get a feel for the team and vision. Just let me know what works best for you, Kway!

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text: Thank you for calling EasyPA! This is Pam, how may I help you?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: I wanted to find out a little bit about EZPA and what you guys do.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Uh, my name is Kway.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text: Thank you, Kway! At EasyPA, our mission is to make healthcare easier for providers by automating the prior authorization process. We use AI to handle about 90% of the paperwork and administrative work that usually slows down clinics and hospitals. This means doctors and staff can spend more time with patients and less time dealing with insurance forms. If you have any specific questions or want to know how it might help your organization, just let me know!

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Me through the workflow of how your platform works with the electronic health records and payers?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Absolutely, Kway! Here’s how EasyPA fits into your workflow with electronic health records (EHRs) and payers.

EasyPA connects directly to your EHR system—like Epic, Cerner, athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and many others—using secure, industry-standard protocols. When a provider needs to submit a prior authorization, they can do it right from their EHR. EasyPA pulls in the necessary patient and clinical information automatically, so there’s no need for double entry.

Once the request is ready, EasyPA submits it electronically to any of the 900+ insurance payers we’re connected with, including all the major ones like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna, Cigna, and Medicare. The platform also checks eligibility in real time and tracks the status of each request, so you always know where things stand.

If you want, I can explain more about the integration process or how the AI helps with documentation and approvals. Just let me know what interests you most,

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Yeah. I wanna know about the integration process.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: And onboarding.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Um, how do I get and get started with own provider?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
Great questions, Kway! Let me walk you through how integration and onboarding work, and how you can get started with your own provider.

The integration process with EasyPA is designed to be simple and fast. Since EasyPA is a web-based platform, there’s no need for complicated technical setup or software installation. If you want to connect it to your EHR, we use secure, industry-standard protocols like HL7 and FHIR, which most EHRs already support. Our team handles the connection, so your clinic can start using EasyPA right away—usually with just a web browser.

For onboarding, once you sign up, we provide training for your staff and set up your account. You’ll have access to support, marketing materials, and a dedicated partner success manager to help you every step of the way. We make sure your team feels comfortable and confident using the platform.

To get started with your own provider, you just need to sign up on our website or reach out to our team. We’ll guide you through the setup, connect your EHR if you want, and get you up and running quickly.

If you’d like, I can share more details about pricing, features, or even set up a demo for you. What would you like to know next,

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: Actually,

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent

retell_transcript_segments.text: I can hear back.

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Customer
retell_transcript_segments.text: like to is there a federal mandate or a legal reason that's driving companies like EasyPA to speed up the prior authorization process?

retell_transcript_segments.speaker: Agent
retell_transcript_segments.text:
That’s a great question, Kway. Yes, there is a big federal push right now to speed up and modernize the prior authorization process.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has issued a new rule that will require all providers and payers to use electronic prior authorization by January 1, 2027. This rule means that providers must submit prior authorizations electronically whenever possible, and payers have to respond much faster—within 72 hours for urgent requests. The goal is to reduce delays, improve transparency, and make sure patients get care without unnecessary holdups.

This mandate is a major reason why companies like EasyPA are focused on automation and electronic solutions. We’re already set up to meet these new requirements, so practices using EasyPA will be ready for compliance and won’t have to worry about last-minute changes.

If you want more details about the CMS rule or how it might affect your practice, just let me know, Kway!

Thanks for clarifying, Kway! For a setup like yours—with one MD provider and six RNs—pricing is really straightforward.

EasyPA’s Pro Plan is $250 per month for each provider. In your case, since you have one MD, your clinic would pay $250 per month. This covers unlimited prior authorizations for your whole team, including your RNs, as long as they’re working under that provider.

There are no hidden fees, no setup costs, and you can cancel anytime. The subscription is month-to-month, so you’re not locked into a long-term contract. Everything is

Absolutely, Kway! I’d be happy to share a bit about our founders and how EasyPA got started.

EasyPA was founded by a team of healthcare and technology experts who saw firsthand how much time and frustration prior authorizations were causing for providers. Dr. Paola Ballester, our CEO, is a Medical Director of Utilization Management at a children’s hospital, with over 15 years of experience leading pediatric care teams and working on the administrative side of healthcare. She’s passionate about making the process easier for both providers and patients.

Our CTO, Alex Vega, is a senior AI software engineer with more than 20 years of experience building secure, scalable systems for healthcare and fintech. He’s an expert in cloud infrastructure and API integrations, which is a big part of why EasyPA is so seamless to use.

Dr. Ralph Martello, our Chief Product & Operating Officer, is a board-certified pediatric hospitalist and an expert in clinical workflow automation. He leads our product vision and user experience, making sure the platform truly fits the needs of real-world providers.

The team came together because they saw a huge need for smarter, faster solutions in healthcare administration. They wanted to build something that would actually make a difference for clinics, hospitals, and patients.

If you’re interested in learning more about investment opportunities or want to connect with the founders directly, I can help set that up for you, Kway!

So far, EasyPA has raised $350,000 in angel commitments, with $135,000 currently in the bank. Right now, we’re in the middle of a $1.2 million pre-seed SAFE round. The funds are being used to build out the product, grow the team, ensure compliance, and expand our go-to-market efforts.

As for milestones, the big goals for the next few quarters are to complete our full production suite for EHR and payer integrations, and to scale up to over 1,000 providers using the platform. The target is to reach $350,000 in monthly recurring revenue by the fourth quarter of 2026. The company’s longer-term goal is to reach profitability with $1.2 million in total funding, and to be ready for a potential exit with $6 million raised.
